metadata.description: Manually curated Roman, Anglo-Saxon, and Medieval sites in Greater Manchester. Sources: Wikipedia, Historic England, academic papers.

properties.name: Mamucium Roman Fort
properties.description: Roman auxiliary fort established ~79 AD during Agricola's northern campaign. Garrison of 500 soldiers. Origin of Manchester.

properties.name: Manchester Roman Vicus
properties.description: Civilian settlement (vicus) outside Mamucium fort. Evidence of metalworking, pottery production, and trade.

properties.name: Castleshaw Roman Forts
properties.description: Two Roman forts: larger Agricolan fort (79 AD) and smaller fortlet (~105 AD). Part of road from Chester to York.

properties.name: Melandra Castle (Ardotalia)
properties.description: Roman auxiliary fort controlling Longdendale pass. Latin name Ardotalia. Excavated 1899-1906.

properties.name: Coccium (Wigan area)
properties.description: Roman fort mentioned in Antonine Itinerary. Exact location uncertain, likely near modern Wigan.

properties.name: Nico Ditch
properties.description: Six-mile defensive ditch from Ashton Moss to Stretford. Proves organized territorial administration pre-Norman.

properties.name: Blackrod Roman Road Section
properties.description: Visible agger of Roman road near Blackrod, part of route from Wigan to Ribchester.

properties.name: Timperley Moated Site
properties.description: Medieval moated manor site. Moats were status symbols for minor gentry.

properties.name: Baguley Hall Moat
properties.description: Medieval moated manor, hall built c.1320 for de Baguley family. Best preserved timber-framed hall in GM.

properties.name: Cuerden Roman Road
properties.description: Section of Roman road on route from Wigan to Lancaster. Part of western Britain road network.

properties.name: Worsley Roman Road
properties.description: Suspected Roman road alignment through Worsley area, connecting Manchester to Wigan.

properties.name: Cathedral Site (Saxon Church)
properties.description: Site of Manchester's earliest church, possibly 7th century Saxon origin. Current cathedral built on same site.

properties.name: Eccles Saxon Settlement
properties.description: Name derives from Latin 'ecclesia' (church), indicating early Christian/Romano-British settlement. One of oldest place names in GM.

properties.name: Gorton Moated Site
properties.description: Medieval moated site in Gorton. Evidence of manorial complex.

properties.name: Stretford Moated Site
properties.description: Medieval moated manor site. Name 'Stretford' indicates Roman road crossing (street + ford).

properties.name: Westhoughton Moated Site
properties.description: Medieval moated manor site near Westhoughton.

properties.name: Stalybridge Roman Altar Find
properties.description: Location where Roman altar stone was discovered. Dedicated to god Apollo, indicates Roman presence in area.

properties.name: Northenden Moated Site
properties.description: Medieval moated manor of the Tatton family. Church nearby has Norman origins.

properties.name: Sale Moated Site
properties.description: Medieval moated manor site near Sale. Part of network of moated sites in south Manchester.

properties.name: Denton Moated Hall
properties.description: Medieval moated site, hall rebuilt in later centuries. Holland family seat.

properties.name: Standish Roman Coin Hoard
properties.description: Location of Roman coin hoard discovery. Indicates Romano-British activity near Wigan.
